Item: Our work on "Online Mapping and Motion Planning under Uncertainty for Safe Navigation in Unknown Environments" has been accepted for publication in IEEE Transactions on Automation Science and Engineering (T-ASE) 2021. Well done, Eric!
Robert Reed and Nate Osikowicz, welcome to the ARIA Systems Group! We are excited to have you in the team!

Our work on "Synergistic Offline-Online Control Synthesis via Local Gaussian Process Regression" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Conference on Decision and Control (CDC) 2021. [Read the preprint here!](https://arxiv.org/abs/2110.05525)
Our work on "Probabilistic Specification Learning for Planning with Safety Constraints" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Int'l Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems (IROS) 2021.
Karan Muvvala successfully defended his thesis. Congratulations Karan!
Our work on "Synthesis for Probabilistic Manipulation Domains" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Int'l Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA) 2021.
Our work on "Explainable Multi-agent Motion Planning" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Int'l Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA) 2021.

Our work on "Strategy synthesis for Unknown Dynamical Systems" has been accepted for presentation at ACM Conference on Hybrid Systems: Computation and Control (HSCC) 2021. [Read the paper here!](https://dl.acm.org/doi/abs/10.1145/3447928.3456649)
Richard Moon successfully defended his thesis. Congratulations Richard!
Akash Ratheesh Babu successfully defended his thesis. Congratulations Akash!
Our work on "LTLf Synthesis on Probabilistic Systems" has been accepted for presentation at the Int. Symposium on Games
Nicholas Renninger successfully defended his thesis. Congratulations Nick!

Our work on "Safety Verification of Unknown Dynamical Systems" has been accepted for presentation at IEEE Conference on Decision and Control (CDC) 2020. [Read the paper here](https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/abstract/document/9303814)!

Our work on "Towards Data-driven Verification of Unknown Dynamical Systems" has been accepted to the Robotics: Science and Systems Workshop for Explainable and Trustworthy Robot Decision Making for Scientific Data Collection. [See full paper here](https://openreview.net/pdf?id=pc1AU6xLol4)!

Our work on "Explainable Multi-Agent Path Finding" has been accepted to the Robotics: Science and Systems Workshop for Explainable and Trustworthy Robot Decision Making for Scientific Data Collection. [See full paper here!](https://etdm2020.github.io/abstracts/RSS_2020_ETDM_Kottinger_Explainable.pdf)

ARIA Systems Group's work on learning specifications has been featured on CEAS News. [See article here](https://www.colorado.edu/engineering/2020/02/10/beyond-mundane-lahijanians-work-safety-critical-systems-pushes-autonomy-forward)!
A paper has been accepted for publication in the IEEE Journal of Transactions on Automatic Control (TAC 2020).
A paper has been accepted for presentation in Int. Conf. on Autonomous Agents and Multiagent Systems (AAMAS 2020).
The ARIA Systems Research Group Website is live!
Franka-Robot has a new home at ARIA Systems.
